intro: Centauropsis antanossi, commonly known as the Madagascar star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale pink. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its foliage is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that have a smooth texture.
